title: Inventor and InventHelp Client Designs More Convenient Television (JMC-1659)
text:
One of America's largest inventor service companies, InventHelp is submitting the HANDS FREE TV to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA
“I was tired of constantly searching for the remote control every time I wanted to watch TV,” said an inventor, from New Orleans, La. “I thought it would be great if there was a quick and easy way to change channels and adjust the volume without a remote, so I invented this.” He invented the patent-pending HANDS FREE TV.
The HANDS FREE TV provides a more efficient way to watch television and change channels. In doing so, it eliminates the need to locate the remote control. As a result, it saves time and it offers added convenience. The invention features an accessible design that is easy to use so it is ideal for households and businesses. Additionally, the HANDS FREE TV is producible in design variations.
The inventor described the invention design. “My design provides a faster and easier way to watch television.”
The original design was submitted to the Telemarketing office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-JMC-1659, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
